meanings.definition: To shed or cast off (skin, feathers, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The snake was sluffing its old skin to make way for a new one.
meanings.sent2: During molting season, birds are often seen sluffing their feathers.
meanings.sent3: The cat was sluffing off its fur like a magician shedding a cloak.
meanings.sent4: The trees were sluffing their leaves, creating a colorful carpet on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The butterfly emerged from its chrysalis after sluffing its cocoon.

meanings.definition: To evade or shirk responsibilities or duties
meanings.sent1: He was caught sluffing off work by pretending to be busy.
meanings.sent2: Students sometimes try to sluff their homework by giving excuses.
meanings.sent3: The employee was sluffing his tasks like a skilled procrastinator.
meanings.sent4: She was sluffing her chores, hoping no one would notice.
meanings.sent5: The politician was sluffing his promises, disappointing his supporters.

meanings.definition: To slide or slip off, as a rope from a drum
meanings.sent1: The rope was sluffing off the drum, causing a safety hazard.
meanings.sent2: The cable sluffed off the pulley due to lack of proper maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The ribbon was sluffing off the spool like a playful snake.
meanings.sent4: The belt sluffed off the wheel, bringing the machine to a halt.
meanings.sent5: The wire sluffed off the reel, creating a tangled mess.
